Dr Isabelle Dehaene from Ghent University Hospital and Dr Frédéric Debiève of the Saint Luc Hospital in Brussels told the weekly Vaccination Task Force press conference on Saturday that getting immunised against COVID-19 is advantageous to pregnant women and involves no known risks.

entry.title: Italian Davide Ballerini wins first Flemish Spring Classic of the season
entry.summary: The cycling season got under way here in Flanders on Saturday with the first Spring Classic race of 2021 the Omloop Het Nieuwsblad. The Italian David Ballerini was the first to complete the 200.5-kilometre course from Ghent to Ninove (both East Flanders). Ballerini rides for the the Belgian Deceuninck-Quickstep team.

entry.summary: From 8 March the Pfizer coronavirus vaccine will be administered at vaccination centres across Belgium for the first time. Belgium’s Vaccination Task Force says that the vaccine will be given to those working in the caring professions that are over the age of 56. The announcement was made at the Task Force’s weekly press briefing.

entry.title: Brussels cyclist killed in road accident remembered
entry.summary: Cycling activists, local residents and friends of a 30-year-old woman killed in a road accident in the Brussels municipality of Vorst last weekend gathered to pay tribute to her on Friday evening. Around 150 people gathered at the place where last Saturday’s fatal accident took place at the junction of the Albertlaan with the Berckendaelstraat.

entry.title: Online version of Batibouw construction trade fair opens today
entry.summary: Belgium’s largest construction industry trade fair opened its doors today. However, due to the measures designed to curb the spread of COVID-19 this year’s fair will take place online rather than at the Brussels Expo exhibition centre. Batibouw 2021 can be visited via a digital platform (available in Dutch and French). Once registered visitors search for products and companies that will help their construction or renovation plans become reality. They will be escorted though the virtual trade fair by means of a chat box and can discuss their plans with exhibitors via online videocalls and chat messaging.

entry.title: Rail worker killed by train
entry.summary: A rail worker has been hit by a train and killed while he was carrying out maintenance work at Ruisbroek in Flemish Brabant. The accident has caused the suspension of services between Brussels and Halle. International Thalys train services between Brussels and Paris were also suspended earlier on Saturday morning and are still suffering delays as a result of the accident.

entry.title: Flemish Government approves recovery loan for bars restaurants and clothing retailers
entry.summary: The Flemish Economy Minister Hilde Crevits (Christian democrat) has announced that the Flemish Government will offer low interest loans to companies that have suffered due to forced closure or a big fall in turnover caused by the coronavirus measures. The loan can, for example, be used by clothing retailers to enable them to buy the latest collection or by restaurants to stock up on provisions ahead of reopening. Ms Crevits announced the Flemish Government’s plans in an interview with VRT Radio 1’s morning news and current affairs programme ‘De ochtend’.

In a letter sent to the hospitals on Friday afternoon Mr Vandenbroucke wrote that Phase 1B of the health care system’s coronavirus action plan will need to be in force by March 8.

entry.title: Piano sold for 60 euro in second-hand shop is worth 18,000 euro
entry.summary: Music-lover Veerle Deknopper couldn’t believe her eyes when she visited a shop selling second-hand goods donated by the public in Mechelen (Antwerp Province). There she saw and bought a piano for just 60 euro. Already pleased with having snapped up a bargain, Ms Deknopper was astounded when she found that the piano, that was made in 1890 is the same as that used by the French pianist Claude Debussy, is in fact worth 18,000 euro.
